schemas.name: Update
schemas.description: This object represents an incoming update.At most one of the optional parameters can be present in any given update.

fields.name: update_id
fields.description: The update‘s unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This ID becomes especially handy if you’re using Webhooks, since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Optional. New incoming message of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

fields.name: edited_message
fields.description: Optional. New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited

fields.name: channel_post
fields.description: Optional. New incoming channel post of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

fields.name: edited_channel_post
fields.description: Optional. New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited

fields.name: inline_query
fields.description: Optional. New incoming inline query

fields.name: chosen_inline_result
fields.description: Optional. The result of an inline query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the feedback collecting for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

fields.name: callback_query
fields.description: Optional. New incoming callback query

fields.name: shipping_query
fields.description: Optional. New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price

fields.name: pre_checkout_query
fields.description: Optional. New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout

fields.name: poll
fields.description: Optional. New poll state. Bots receive only updates about polls, which are sent or stopped by the bot

schemas.name: WebhookInfo
schemas.description: Contains information about the current status of a webhook.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up

fields.name: has_custom_certificate
fields.description: True, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks

fields.name: pending_update_count
fields.description: Number of updates awaiting delivery

fields.name: last_error_date
fields.description: Optional. Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

fields.name: last_error_message
fields.description: Optional. Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

fields.name: max_connections
fields.description: Optional. Maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery

fields.name: allowed_updates
fields.description: Optional. A list of update types the bot is subscribed to. Defaults to all update types

schemas.name: User
schemas.description: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot

fields.name: is_bot
fields.description: True, if this user is a bot

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: User‘s or bot’s first name

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. User‘s or bot’s last name

fields.name: username
fields.description: Optional. User‘s or bot’s username

fields.name: language_code
fields.description: Optional. IETF language tag of the user's language

schemas.name: Chat
schemas.description: This object represents a chat.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of chat, can be either “private”, “group”, “supergroup” or “channel”

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

fields.name: username
fields.description: Optional. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: Optional. First name of the other party in a private chat

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. Last name of the other party in a private chat

fields.name: all_members_are_administrators
fields.description: Optional. True if a group has ‘All Members Are Admins’ enabled.

fields.name: photo
fields.description: Optional. Chat photo. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Optional. Description, for supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: invite_link
fields.description: Optional. Chat invite link, for supergroups and channel chats. Each administrator in a chat generates their own invite links, so the bot must first generate the link using exportChatInviteLink. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: pinned_message
fields.description: Optional. Pinned message, for groups, supergroups and channels. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: sticker_set_name
fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, name of group sticker set. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: can_set_sticker_set
fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot can change the group sticker set. Returned only in getChat.

schemas.name: Message
schemas.description: This object represents a message.

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat

fields.name: from
fields.description: Optional. Sender, empty for messages sent to channels

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Conversation the message belongs to

fields.name: forward_from
fields.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, sender of the original message

fields.name: forward_from_chat
fields.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels, information about the original channel

fields.name: forward_from_message_id
fields.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels, identifier of the original message in the channel

fields.name: forward_signature
fields.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels, signature of the post author if present

fields.name: forward_sender_name
fields.description: Optional. Sender's name for messages forwarded from users who disallow adding a link to their account in forwarded messages

fields.name: forward_date
fields.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, date the original message was sent in Unix time

fields.name: reply_to_message
fields.description: Optional. For replies, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

fields.name: edit_date
fields.description: Optional. Date the message was last edited in Unix time

fields.name: media_group_id
fields.description: Optional. The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to

fields.name: author_signature
fields.description: Optional. Signature of the post author for messages in channels

fields.name: text
fields.description: Optional. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message, 0-4096 characters.

fields.name: entities
fields.description: Optional. For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption

fields.name: audio
fields.description: Optional. Message is an audio file, information about the file

fields.name: document
fields.description: Optional. Message is a general file, information about the file

fields.name: animation
fields.description: Optional. Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the document field will also be set

fields.name: game
fields.description: Optional. Message is a game, information about the game. More about games »

fields.name: photo
fields.description: Optional. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: Optional. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

fields.name: video
fields.description: Optional. Message is a video, information about the video

fields.name: voice
fields.description: Optional. Message is a voice message, information about the file

fields.name: video_note
fields.description: Optional. Message is a video note, information about the video message

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption for the animation, audio, document, photo, video or voice, 0-1024 characters

fields.name: contact
fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

fields.name: location
fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location

fields.name: venue
fields.description: Optional. Message is a venue, information about the venue

fields.name: poll
fields.description: Optional. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

fields.name: new_chat_members
fields.description: Optional. New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)

fields.name: left_chat_member
fields.description: Optional. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)

fields.name: new_chat_title
fields.description: Optional. A chat title was changed to this value

fields.name: new_chat_photo
fields.description: Optional. A chat photo was change to this value

fields.name: delete_chat_photo
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the chat photo was deleted

fields.name: group_chat_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the group has been created

fields.name: supergroup_chat_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can‘t be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can’t be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.

fields.name: channel_chat_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can‘t be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can’t be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.

fields.name: migrate_to_chat_id
fields.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: migrate_from_chat_id
fields.description: Optional. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: pinned_message
fields.description: Optional. Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it is itself a reply.

fields.name: invoice
fields.description: Optional. Message is an invoice for a payment, information about the invoice. More about payments »

fields.name: successful_payment
fields.description: Optional. Message is a service message about a successful payment, information about the payment. More about payments »

fields.name: connected_website
fields.description: Optional. The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. More about Telegram Login »

fields.name: passport_data
fields.description: Optional. Telegram Passport data

schemas.name: MessageEntity
schemas.description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the entity. Can be mention (@username), hashtag, cashtag, bot_command, url, email, phone_number, bold (bold text), italic (italic text), code (monowidth string), pre (monowidth block), text_link (for clickable text URLs), text_mention (for users without usernames)

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Offset in UTF-16 code units to the start of the entity

fields.name: length
fields.description: Length of the entity in UTF-16 code units

fields.name: url
fields.description: Optional. For “text_link” only, url that will be opened after user taps on the text

fields.name: user
fields.description: Optional. For “text_mention” only, the mentioned user

schemas.name: PhotoSize
schemas.description: This object represents one size of a photo or a file / sticker thumbnail.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file

fields.name: width
fields.description: Photo width

fields.name: height
fields.description: Photo height

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size

schemas.name: Audio
schemas.description: This object represents an audio file to be treated as music by the Telegram clients.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

fields.name: performer
fields.description: Optional. Performer of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size

fields.name: thumb
fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the album cover to which the music file belongs

schemas.name: Document
schemas.description: This object represents a general file (as opposed to photos, voice messages and audio files).

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Unique file identifier

fields.name: thumb
fields.description: Optional. Document thumbnail as defined by sender

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size

schemas.name: Video
schemas.description: This object represents a video file.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file

fields.name: width
fields.description: Video width as defined by sender

fields.name: height
fields.description: Video height as defined by sender

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

fields.name: thumb
fields.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. Mime type of a file as defined by sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size

schemas.name: Animation
schemas.description: This object represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound).

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Unique file identifier

fields.name: width
fields.description: Video width as defined by sender

fields.name: height
fields.description: Video height as defined by sender

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

fields.name: thumb
fields.description: Optional. Animation thumbnail as defined by sender

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: Optional. Original animation filename as defined by sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size

schemas.name: Voice
schemas.description: This object represents a voice note.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size

schemas.name: VideoNote
schemas.description: This object represents a video message (available in Telegram apps as of v.4.0).

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file

fields.name: length
fields.description: Video width and height (diameter of the video message) as defined by sender

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

fields.name: thumb
fields.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size

schemas.name: Contact
schemas.description: This object represents a phone contact.

fields.name: phone_number
fields.description: Contact's phone number

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: Contact's first name

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. Contact's last name

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Optional. Contact's user identifier in Telegram

fields.name: vcard
fields.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard

schemas.name: Location
schemas.description: This object represents a point on the map.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Longitude as defined by sender

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Latitude as defined by sender

schemas.name: Venue
schemas.description: This object represents a venue.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Venue location

fields.name: title
fields.description: Name of the venue

fields.name: address
fields.description: Address of the venue

fields.name: foursquare_id
fields.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue

fields.name: foursquare_type
fields.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

schemas.name: PollOption
schemas.description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

fields.name: voter_count
fields.description: Number of users that voted for this option

schemas.name: Poll
schemas.description: This object contains information about a poll.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique poll identifier

fields.name: question
fields.description: Poll question, 1-255 characters

fields.name: options
fields.description: List of poll options

fields.name: is_closed
fields.description: True, if the poll is closed

schemas.name: UserProfilePhotos
schemas.description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

fields.name: total_count
fields.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

fields.name: photos
fields.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

schemas.name: File
schemas.description:
Maximum file size to download is 20 MB

This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size, if known

fields.name: file_path
fields.description: Optional. File path. Use https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path> to get the file.

schemas.name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
schemas.description: This object represents a custom keyboard with reply options (see Introduction to bots for details and examples).

fields.name: keyboard
fields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of KeyboardButton objects

fields.name: resize_keyboard
fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

fields.name: one_time_keyboard
fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat – the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to false.

fields.name: selective
fields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.Example: A user requests to change the bot‘s language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don’t see the keyboard.

schemas.name: KeyboardButton
schemas.description: This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. For simple text buttons String can be used instead of this object to specify text of the button. Optional fields are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text of the button. If none of the optional fields are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed

fields.name: request_contact
fields.description: Optional. If True, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only

fields.name: request_location
fields.description: Optional. If True, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only

schemas.name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
schemas.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see ReplyKeyboardMarkup).

fields.name: remove_keyboard
fields.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use one_time_keyboard in ReplyKeyboardMarkup)

fields.name: selective
fields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

schemas.name: InlineKeyboardMarkup
schemas.description: This object represents an inline keyboard that appears right next to the message it belongs to.

fields.name: inline_keyboard
fields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of InlineKeyboardButton objects

schemas.name: InlineKeyboardButton
schemas.description: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Label text on the button

fields.name: url
fields.description: Optional. HTTP or tg:// url to be opened when button is pressed

fields.name: callback_data
fields.description: Optional. Data to be sent in a callback query to the bot when button is pressed, 1-64 bytes

fields.name: switch_inline_query
fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot‘s username and the specified inline query in the input field. Can be empty, in which case just the bot’s username will be inserted.Note: This offers an easy way for users to start using your bot in inline mode when they are currently in a private chat with it. Especially useful when combined with switch_pm… actions – in this case the user will be automatically returned to the chat they switched from, skipping the chat selection screen.

fields.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat
fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will insert the bot‘s username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. Can be empty, in which case only the bot’s username will be inserted.This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat – good for selecting something from multiple options.

fields.name: callback_game
fields.description: Optional. Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button.NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.

fields.name: pay
fields.description: Optional. Specify True, to send a Pay button.NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.

schemas.name: CallbackQuery
schemas.description: This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an inline keyboard. If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field message will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in inline mode), the field inline_message_id will be present. Exactly one of the fields data or game_short_name will be present.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this query

fields.name: from
fields.description: Sender

fields.name: message
fields.description: Optional. Message with the callback button that originated the query. Note that message content and message date will not be available if the message is too old

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.

fields.name: chat_instance
fields.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in games.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Optional. Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

fields.name: game_short_name
fields.description: Optional. Short name of a Game to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game

schemas.name: ForceReply
schemas.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot‘s message and tapped ’Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice privacy mode.

fields.name: force_reply
fields.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot‘s message and tapped ’Reply'

fields.name: selective
fields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

schemas.name: ChatPhoto
schemas.description: This object represents a chat photo.

fields.name: small_file_id
fields.description: Unique file identifier of small (160x160) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download.

fields.name: big_file_id
fields.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download.

schemas.name: ChatMember
schemas.description: This object contains information about one member of a chat.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

fields.name: status
fields.description: The member's status in the chat. Can be “creator”, “administrator”, “member”, “restricted”, “left” or “kicked”

fields.name: until_date
fields.description: Optional. Restricted and kicked only. Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user, unix time

fields.name: can_be_edited
fields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the bot is allowed to edit administrator privileges of that user

fields.name: can_change_info
fields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can change the chat title, photo and other settings

fields.name: can_post_messages
fields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can post in the channel, channels only

fields.name: can_edit_messages
fields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages, channels only

fields.name: can_delete_messages
fields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

fields.name: can_invite_users
fields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can invite new users to the chat

fields.name: can_restrict_members
fields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

fields.name: can_pin_messages
fields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can pin messages, groups and supergroups only

fields.name: can_promote_members
fields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of his own privileges or demote administrators that he has promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

fields.name: is_member
fields.description: Optional. Restricted only. True, if the user is a member of the chat at the moment of the request

fields.name: can_send_messages
fields.description: Optional. Restricted only. True, if the user can send text messages, contacts, locations and venues

fields.name: can_send_media_messages
fields.description: Optional. Restricted only. True, if the user can send audios, documents, photos, videos, video notes and voice notes, implies can_send_messages

fields.name: can_send_other_messages
fields.description: Optional. Restricted only. True, if the user can send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots, implies can_send_media_messages

fields.name: can_add_web_page_previews
fields.description: Optional. Restricted only. True, if user may add web page previews to his messages, implies can_send_media_messages

schemas.name: ResponseParameters
schemas.description: Contains information about why a request was unsuccessful.

fields.name: migrate_to_chat_id
fields.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: retry_after
fields.description: Optional. In case of exceeding flood control, the number of seconds left to wait before the request can be repeated

schemas.name: InputMediaPhoto
schemas.description: Represents a photo to be sent.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be photo

fields.name: media
fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More info on Sending Files »

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Send Markdown or HTML, if you want Telegram apps to show bold, italic, fixed-width text or inline URLs in the media caption.

schemas.name: InputMediaVideo
schemas.description: Represents a video to be sent.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be video

fields.name: media
fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More info on Sending Files »

fields.name: thumb
fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail‘s width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can’t be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More info on Sending Files »

fields.description: Optional. Video width

fields.name: height

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Optional. Video duration

fields.name: supports_streaming
fields.description: Optional. Pass True, if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming

schemas.description: This object represents a sticker set.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.description: Sticker set title

fields.name: contains_masks
fields.description: True, if the sticker set contains masks

fields.name: stickers
fields.description: List of all set stickers

schemas.name: MaskPosition
schemas.description: This object describes the position on faces where a mask should be placed by default.

fields.name: point
fields.description: The part of the face relative to which the mask should be placed. One of “forehead”, “eyes”, “mouth”, or “chin”.

fields.name: x_shift
fields.description: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. For example, choosing -1.0 will place mask just to the left of the default mask position.

fields.name: y_shift
fields.description: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position.

fields.name: scale
fields.description: Mask scaling coefficient. For example, 2.0 means double size.

If an InlineQueryResultVideo message contains an embedded video (e.g., YouTube), you must replace its content using input_message_content.

Represents a link to a page containing an embedded video player or a video file. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

fields.name: video_height

fields.name: video_duration
fields.description: Optional. Video duration in seconds

fields.description: Optional. Short description of the result

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

fields.name: input_message_content
fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video. This field is required if InlineQueryResultVideo is used to send an HTML-page as a result (e.g., a YouTube video).

schemas.name: EncryptedPassportElement
schemas.description: Contains information about documents or other Telegram Passport elements shared with the bot by the user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Element type. One of “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “address”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”, “phone_number”, “email”.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Optional. Base64-encoded encrypted Telegram Passport element data provided by the user, available for “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport” and “address” types. Can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: phone_number
fields.description: Optional. User's verified phone number, available only for “phone_number” type

fields.name: email
fields.description: Optional. User's verified email address, available only for “email” type

fields.name: files
fields.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with documents provided by the user, available for “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: front_side
fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the front side of the document, provided by the user. Available for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: reverse_side
fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the reverse side of the document, provided by the user. Available for “driver_license” and “identity_card”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: selfie
fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the selfie of the user holding a document, provided by the user; available for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: translation
fields.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with translated versions of documents provided by the user. Available if requested for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: Base64-encoded element hash for using in PassportElementErrorUnspecified

schemas.name: EncryptedCredentials

fields.name: data

fields.name: hash

fields.name: secret
fields.description: Base64-encoded secret, encrypted with the bot's public RSA key, required for data decryption

methods.name: getUpdates
methods.description: Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling (wiki). An Array of Update objects is returned.

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Identifier of the first update to be returned. Must be greater by one than the highest among the identifiers of previously received updates. By default, updates starting with the earliest unconfirmed update are returned. An update is considered confirmed as soon as getUpdates is called with an offset higher than its update_id. The negative offset can be specified to retrieve updates starting from -offset update from the end of the updates queue. All previous updates will forgotten.

fields.name: limit
fields.description: Limits the number of updates to be retrieved. Values between 1—100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: Timeout in seconds for long polling. Defaults to 0, i.e. usual short polling. Should be positive, short polling should be used for testing purposes only.

fields.name: allowed_updates
fields.description: List the types of updates you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all updates regardless of type (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the getUpdates, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

methods.name: setWebhook
methods.description:
If you'd like to make sure that the Webhook request comes from Telegram, we recommend using a secret path in the URL, e.g. https://www.example.com/<token>. Since nobody else knows your bot‘s token, you can be pretty sure it’s us.
Use this method to specify a url and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook. Whenever there is an update for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the specified url, containing a JSON-serialized Update. In case of an unsuccessful request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts. Returns True on success.

fields.name: url
fields.description: HTTPS url to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration

fields.name: certificate
fields.description: Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked. See our self-signed guide for details.

fields.name: max_connections
fields.description: Maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery, 1-100. Defaults to 40. Use lower values to limit the load on your bot‘s server, and higher values to increase your bot’s throughput.

fields.name: allowed_updates
fields.description: List the types of updates you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all updates regardless of type (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the setWebhook, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Use this method to send text messages. On success, the sent Message is returned.

fields.description: Text of the message to be sent

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Send Markdown or HTML, if you want Telegram apps to show bold, italic, fixed-width text or inline URLs in your bot's message.

fields.name: disable_web_page_preview
fields.description: Disables link previews for links in this message

fields.name: disable_notification
fields.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

fields.name: reply_to_message_id
fields.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.type: InlineKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardRemove or ForceReply
fields.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

methods.description:
For sending voice messages, use the sendVoice method instead.
Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display them in the music player. Your audio must be in the .mp3 format. On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send audio files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.

fields.name: thumb
fields.description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail‘s width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can’t be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More info on Sending Files »

fields.name: chat_id

fields.name: video
fields.description: Video to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a video that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a video from the Internet, or upload a new video using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files »

fields.name: width

fields.name: height
fields.description: Video height

fields.name: thumb
fields.description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail‘s width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can’t be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More info on Sending Files »

fields.name: parse_mode

methods.name: sendChatAction
methods.description:
We only recommend using this method when a response from the bot will take a noticeable amount of time to arrive.

Example: The ImageBot needs some time to process a request and upload the image. Instead of sending a text message along the lines of “Retrieving image, please wait…”, the bot may use sendChatAction with action = upload_photo. The user will see a “sending photo” status for the bot.

Use this method when you need to tell the user that something is happening on the bot's side. The status is set for 5 seconds or less (when a message arrives from your bot, Telegram clients clear its typing status). Returns True on success.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: action
fields.description: Type of action to broadcast. Choose one, depending on what the user is about to receive: typing for text messages, upload_photo for photos, record_video or upload_video for videos, record_audio or upload_audio for audio files, upload_document for general files, find_location for location data, record_video_note or upload_video_note for video notes.

methods.name: getUserProfilePhotos
methods.description: Use this method to get a list of profile pictures for a user. Returns a UserProfilePhotos object.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Sequential number of the first photo to be returned. By default, all photos are returned.

fields.name: limit
fields.description: Limits the number of photos to be retrieved. Values between 1—100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

methods.name: getFile
methods.description: Use this method to get basic info about a file and prepare it for downloading. For the moment, bots can download files of up to 20MB in size. On success, a File object is returned. The file can then be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>, where <file_path> is taken from the response. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile again.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: File identifier to get info about

methods.name: kickChatMember
methods.description:
Note: In regular groups (non-supergroups), this method will only work if the ‘All Members Are Admins’ setting is off in the target group. Otherwise members may only be removed by the group's creator or by the member that added them.

Use this method to kick a user from a group, a supergroup or a channel. In the case of supergroups and channels, the user will not be able to return to the group on their own using invite links, etc., unless unbanned first. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns True on success.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target group or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user

fields.name: until_date
fields.description: Date when the user will be unbanned, unix time. If user is banned for more than 366 days or less than 30 seconds from the current time they are considered to be banned forever

methods.name: unbanChatMember
methods.description: Use this method to unban a previously kicked user in a supergroup or channel. The user will not return to the group or channel automatically, but will be able to join via link, etc. The bot must be an administrator for this to work. Returns True on success.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target group or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @username)

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user

fields.name: until_date
fields.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for the user, unix time. If user is restricted for more than 366 days or less than 30 seconds from the current time, they are considered to be restricted forever

fields.name: can_send_other_messages
fields.description: Pass True, if the user can send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots, implies can_send_media_messages

fields.name: can_add_web_page_previews
fields.description: Pass True, if the user may add web page previews to their messages, implies can_send_media_messages

methods.name: promoteChatMember

fields.name: can_post_messages

fields.name: can_edit_messages

fields.name: can_delete_messages

fields.name: can_invite_users

fields.name: can_pin_messages

methods.description:
Alternatively, the user can be redirected to the specified Game URL. For this option to work, you must first create a game for your bot via @Botfather and accept the terms. Otherwise, you may use links like t.me/your_bot?start=XXXX that open your bot with a parameter.

If you have created a Game and accepted the conditions via @Botfather, specify the URL that opens your game – note that this will only work if the query comes from a callback_game button.Otherwise, you may use links like t.me/your_bot?start=XXXX that open your bot with a parameter.

methods.description: Use this method to edit captions of messages. On success, if edited message is sent by the bot, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

fields.name: caption
fields.description: New caption of the message

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Send Markdown or HTML, if you want Telegram apps to show bold, italic, fixed-width text or inline URLs in the media caption.

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard.

methods.name: editMessageMedia
methods.description: Use this method to edit animation, audio, document, photo, or video messages. If a message is a part of a message album, then it can be edited only to a photo or a video. Otherwise, message type can be changed arbitrarily. When inline message is edited, new file can't be uploaded. Use previously uploaded file via its file_id or specify a URL. On success, if the edited message was sent by the bot, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

fields.name: media
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new media content of the message

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new inline keyboard.

methods.name: editMessageReplyMarkup
methods.description: Use this method to edit only the reply markup of messages. On success, if edited message is sent by the bot, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard.

methods.name: stopPoll
methods.description: Use this method to stop a poll which was sent by the bot. On success, the stopped Poll with the final results is returned.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Identifier of the original message with the poll

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new message inline keyboard.

methods.name: deleteMessage
methods.description: Use this method to delete a message, including service messages, with the following limitations:- A message can only be deleted if it was sent less than 48 hours ago.- Bots can delete outgoing messages in private chats, groups, and supergroups.- Bots can delete incoming messages in private chats.- Bots granted can_post_messages permissions can delete outgoing messages in channels.- If the bot is an administrator of a group, it can delete any message there.- If the bot has can_delete_messages permission in a supergroup or a channel, it can delete any message there.Returns True on success.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Identifier of the message to delete

methods.name: sendSticker
methods.description: Use this method to send .webp stickers. On success, the sent Message is returned.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: Sticker to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a .webp file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files »

fields.name: disable_notification
fields.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

fields.name: reply_to_message_id
fields.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.type: InlineKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardRemove or ForceReply
fields.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

methods.name: getStickerSet
methods.description: Use this method to get a sticker set. On success, a StickerSet object is returned.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the sticker set

methods.name: uploadStickerFile
methods.description: Use this method to upload a .png file with a sticker for later use in createNewStickerSet and addStickerToSet methods (can be used multiple times). Returns the uploaded File on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of sticker file owner

fields.name: png_sticker
fields.description: Png image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. More info on Sending Files »

methods.name: createNewStickerSet
methods.description: Use this method to create new sticker set owned by a user. The bot will be able to edit the created sticker set. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of created sticker set owner

fields.name: name
fields.description: Short name of sticker set, to be used in t.me/addstickers/ URLs (e.g., animals). Can contain only english letters, digits and underscores. Must begin with a letter, can't contain consecutive underscores and must end in “_by_<bot username>”. <bot_username> is case insensitive. 1-64 characters.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

fields.name: png_sticker
fields.description: Png image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files »

fields.name: emojis
fields.description: One or more emoji corresponding to the sticker

fields.name: contains_masks
fields.description: Pass True, if a set of mask stickers should be created

fields.name: mask_position
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for position where the mask should be placed on faces

methods.name: addStickerToSet
methods.description: Use this method to add a new sticker to a set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of sticker set owner

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.name: png_sticker
fields.description: Png image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files »

fields.name: emojis
fields.description: One or more emoji corresponding to the sticker

fields.name: mask_position
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for position where the mask should be placed on faces

methods.name: setStickerPositionInSet
methods.description: Use this method to move a sticker in a set created by the bot to a specific position . Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

fields.name: position
fields.description: New sticker position in the set, zero-based

methods.name: deleteStickerFromSet
methods.description: Use this method to delete a sticker from a set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

methods.name: answerInlineQuery
methods.description: Use this method to send answers to an inline query. On success, True is returned.No more than 50 results per query are allowed.

fields.name: inline_query_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the answered query

fields.name: results
fields.description: A JSON-serialized array of results for the inline query

fields.name: cache_time
fields.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.

fields.name: is_personal
fields.description: Pass True, if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query

fields.name: next_offset
fields.description: Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don‘t support pagination. Offset length can’t exceed 64 bytes.

fields.name: switch_pm_text
fields.description: If passed, clients will display a button with specified text that switches the user to a private chat with the bot and sends the bot a start message with the parameter switch_pm_parameter

fields.name: switch_pm_parameter
fields.description: Deep-linking parameter for the /start message sent to the bot when user presses the switch button. 1-64 characters, only A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed.Example: An inline bot that sends YouTube videos can ask the user to connect the bot to their YouTube account to adapt search results accordingly. To do this, it displays a ‘Connect your YouTube account’ button above the results, or even before showing any. The user presses the button, switches to a private chat with the bot and, in doing so, passes a start parameter that instructs the bot to return an oauth link. Once done, the bot can offer a switch_inline button so that the user can easily return to the chat where they wanted to use the bot's inline capabilities.

methods.name: sendInvoice
methods.description: Use this method to send invoices. On success, the sent Message is returned.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target private chat

fields.name: title
fields.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

fields.name: description
fields.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.

fields.name: provider_token
fields.description: Payments provider token, obtained via Botfather

fields.name: start_parameter
fields.description: Unique deep-linking parameter that can be used to generate this invoice when used as a start parameter

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies

fields.name: prices
fields.description: Price breakdown, a list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.)

fields.name: provider_data
fields.description: JSON-encoded data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

fields.name: photo_url
fields.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

fields.name: photo_size
fields.description: Photo size

fields.name: photo_width
fields.description: Photo width

fields.name: photo_height
fields.description: Photo height

fields.name: need_name
fields.description: Pass True, if you require the user's full name to complete the order

fields.name: need_phone_number
fields.description: Pass True, if you require the user's phone number to complete the order

fields.name: need_email
fields.description: Pass True, if you require the user's email address to complete the order

fields.name: need_shipping_address
fields.description: Pass True, if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order

fields.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
fields.description: Pass True, if user's phone number should be sent to provider

fields.name: send_email_to_provider
fields.description: Pass True, if user's email address should be sent to provider

fields.name: is_flexible
fields.description: Pass True, if the final price depends on the shipping method

fields.name: disable_notification
fields.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

fields.name: reply_to_message_id
fields.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Pay total price' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must be a Pay button.

methods.name: answerShippingQuery
methods.description: If you sent an invoice requesting a shipping address and the parameter is_flexible was specified, the Bot API will send an Update with a shipping_query field to the bot. Use this method to reply to shipping queries. On success, True is returned.

fields.name: shipping_query_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

fields.name: ok
fields.description: Specify True if delivery to the specified address is possible and False if there are any problems (for example, if delivery to the specified address is not possible)

fields.name: shipping_options
fields.description: Required if ok is True. A JSON-serialized array of available shipping options.

fields.name: error_message
fields.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. "Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable'). Telegram will display this message to the user.

methods.name: answerPreCheckoutQuery
methods.description: Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the Bot API sends the final confirmation in the form of an Update with the field pre_checkout_query. Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries. On success, True is returned. Note: The Bot API must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.

fields.name: pre_checkout_query_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

fields.name: ok
fields.description: Specify True if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order. Use False if there are any problems.

fields.name: error_message
fields.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

methods.name: setPassportDataErrors
methods.description:
Use this if the data submitted by the user doesn't satisfy the standards your service requires for any reason. For example, if a birthday date seems invalid, a submitted document is blurry, a scan shows evidence of tampering, etc. Supply some details in the error message to make sure the user knows how to correct the issues.
Informs a user that some of the Telegram Passport elements they provided contains errors. The user will not be able to re-submit their Passport to you until the errors are fixed (the contents of the field for which you returned the error must change). Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier

fields.name: errors
fields.description: A JSON-serialized array describing the errors

methods.name: sendGame
methods.description: Use this method to send a game. On success, the sent Message is returned.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat

fields.name: game_short_name
fields.description: Short name of the game, serves as the unique identifier for the game. Set up your games via Botfather.

fields.name: disable_notification
fields.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

fields.name: reply_to_message_id
fields.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one ‘Play game_title’ button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must launch the game.

methods.name: setGameScore
methods.description: Use this method to set the score of the specified user in a game. On success, if the message was sent by the bot, returns the edited Message, otherwise returns True. Returns an error, if the new score is not greater than the user's current score in the chat and force is False.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier

fields.name: score
fields.description: New score, must be non-negative

fields.name: force
fields.description: Pass True, if the high score is allowed to decrease. This can be useful when fixing mistakes or banning cheaters

fields.name: disable_edit_message
fields.description: Pass True, if the game message should not be automatically edited to include the current scoreboard

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

methods.name: getGameHighScores
methods.description:
This method will currently return scores for the target user, plus two of his closest neighbors on each side. Will also return the top three users if the user and his neighbors are not among them. Please note that this behavior is subject to change.

Use this method to get data for high score tables. Will return the score of the specified user and several of his neighbors in a game. On success, returns an Array of GameHighScore objects.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Target user id

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message
